Name: Hawaiian Eye
Ingredients: 40 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
20 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Tiki mug or collins glass .
Prepare garnish of orchid or other edible flower.
DRY BLEND (without ice) first 5 ingredients on slow setting and gradually add Xanthan gum while continuing to blend.
Add 7oz scoop of crushed ice and BLEND some more.
Review: Subtle clove spice and lime juice sits harmoniously with a duo of rums. A much used flavour combo but still a great cocktail worthy of a fresh outing.
History: A famous Tiki cocktail created circa 1963 by Tony Ramos at China Trader restaurant in Toluca Lake, California, USA, for the cast of the TV series of the same name who were filming at the nearby Warner Brothers Studios. Originally served in an iconic and now very collectable Hawaiian Eye mug.
